org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth

Class BluetoothLeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth.BluetoothLeHandler

  • public class BluetoothLeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic class for connecting multiple devices and defining different actions for different services and characteristics. This class is a singleton, meaning that there can exist only one instance at a time, which can be obtained by calling getInstance().
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Class handling all callbacks from bluetooth devices.

      Class representing a service-characteristic pair.

      • GATT_FAILS_REQUIREMENTS

        public static final int GATT_FAILS_REQUIREMENTS
        Possible status for BluetoothGattCallback.onServicesDiscovered(BluetoothGatt, int) which indicates that the server does not satisfy the requirements provided with connectGatt(BluetoothDevice, BluetoothGattCallback, Set[]).
        See Also:
        connectGatt(BluetoothDevice, BluetoothGattCallback, Set[]), BluetoothGattCallback.onServicesDiscovered(BluetoothGatt, int), Constant Field Values

      • gatts

        private java.util.Map<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice,android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt> gatts
        The BluetoothGatts connected.

      • callbacks

        private java.util.Map<BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair,android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback> callbacks
        The provided callbacks associated with a BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair. These are executed at:
        • BluetoothLeHandler.GeneralCallback.onCharacteristicRead(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, int)
        • BluetoothLeHandler.GeneralCallback.onCharacteristicWrite(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, int)
        • BluetoothLeHandler.GeneralCallback.onCharacteristicChanged(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic)
        See Also:
        addCallback(UUID, UUID, boolean, BluetoothGattCallback), removeCallback(BluetoothGattCallback)

      • gattConnectCallbacks

        private java.util.Map<android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt,android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback> gattConnectCallbacks
        The provided callbacks associated with a BluetoothGatt. These are executed at:
        • BluetoothLeHandler.GeneralCallback.onConnectionStateChange(BluetoothGatt, int, int)
        • BluetoothLeHandler.GeneralCallback.onServicesDiscovered(BluetoothGatt, int)
        See Also:
        connectGatt(BluetoothDevice, BluetoothGattCallback, Set[]), removeGattConnectCallback(BluetoothGattCallback)

      • gattRequirements

        private java.util.Map<android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt,java.util.List<java.util.Set<BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair>>> gattRequirements
        Requirements associated with the BluetoothGatt. A requirement is a Set of BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair which the device must provide. A device must match at least one of the requirements to pass the test.
        See Also:
        connectGatt(BluetoothDevice, BluetoothGattCallback, Set[])

      • notifyServiceCharacteristicPairs

        private java.util.Set<BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair> notifyServiceCharacteristicPairs
        Set of BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair that must be flagged for notifications.
        See Also:
        enableNotification(BluetoothGatt, UUID, UUID, boolean), enableNotifications(boolean), enableNotifications(BluetoothGatt, boolean)

      • queue

        private java.util.Queue<BluetoothLeHandler.PendingAction> queue
        Queue of pending actions. NB: the device can only do one action at a time!
        See Also:
        nextAction(), doAction(BluetoothGatt, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, int)

      • doAction

        private void doAction(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                      android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic,
                      int action)
        Adds an action to the queue and, if no action is currently executed, executes it.
        Parameters:
        gatt - the BluetoothGatt server to which the action will be done.
        characteristic - the BluetoothGattCharacteristic of the gatt to which the action will be done.
        action - the action to be done. It must be one of ACTION_READ or ACTION_WRITE.

      • addCallback

        public boolean addCallback(java.util.UUID service,
                           java.util.UUID characteristic,
                           boolean notify,
                           android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback callback)
        Adds a new callback for the specified pair of service and characteristic. If notify is true, then notifications on currently connected devices will be enabled for the matching pairs.
        Parameters:
        service - the UUID of the BluetoothGattService.
        characteristic - the UUID of the BluetoothGattCharacteristic.
        notify - the flag specifying whether to ask connected devices to notify changes on this BluetoothGattCharacteristic.
        callback - the callback to be executed when this service characteristic pair is received.
        Returns:
        true if there was already another callback associated with this pair that has been replaced, false otherwise.

      • removeCallback

        public int removeCallback(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback callback)
        Removes the given callback.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be removed
        Returns:
        number of callback occurrences removed.
        See Also:
        addCallback(UUID, UUID, boolean, BluetoothGattCallback), removeGattConnectCallback(BluetoothGattCallback)

      • connectGatt

        public boolean connectGatt(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                           android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback connectionStateCallback,
                           java.util.Set<BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair>... requirements)
        Connects to the specified BluetoothDevice. The given BluetoothGattCallback will be executed when device is connected and when its services are being discovered. Optionally, an array of requirements can be passed to this function. A requirement is a Set of BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair that the device must contain. At least one of the given requirements must be matched in order for the device to pass the test. In the most simple use-case, there will be just one requirement with one single BluetoothLeHandler.ServiceCharacteristicPair representing the BluetoothGattCharacteristic that a BluetoothGattCallback has been registered for.
        Parameters:
        device - the device to connect to.
        connectionStateCallback - the callback to be called when device is connected and when its services are being discovered.
        requirements - the requirements the device must match as described previously.
        Returns:
        true if initialization of connection is successful, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if no context has previously been set.
        See Also:
        setContext(Context), removeGattConnectCallback(BluetoothGattCallback)

      • removeGattConnectCallback

        public int removeGattConnectCallback(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback callback)
        Removes the given callback from the callbacks associated with a device connection event.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be removed
        Returns:
        number of callback occurrences removed.
        See Also:
        connectGatt(BluetoothDevice, BluetoothGattCallback, Set[]), removeCallback(BluetoothGattCallback)

      • readCharacteristic

        public void readCharacteristic(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt readGatt,
                               java.util.UUID readService,
                               java.util.UUID readCharacteristic)
        Reads the given service-characteristic pair from the given device.
        Parameters:
        readGatt - the GATT server to read from or null if all connected GATT servers should be checked.
        readService - the BluetoothGattService to read from or null if all services must be checked.
        readCharacteristic - the BluetoothGattCharacteristic fto read from or null if all BluetoothGattCharacteristics in the given BluetoothGattService must be read.
        See Also:
        writeCharacteristic(BluetoothGatt, UUID, UUID, byte[])

      • writeCharacteristic

        public void writeCharacteristic(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt writeGatt,
                                java.util.UUID writeService,
                                java.util.UUID writeCharacteristic,
                                byte[] newValue)
        Writes the given value to the given service-characteristic pair in the given device.
        Parameters:
        writeGatt - the GATT server to write to or null if all connected GATT servers should be checked.
        writeService - the BluetoothGattService to write to or null if all services must be checked.
        writeCharacteristic - the BluetoothGattCharacteristic to write to or null if all BluetoothGattCharacteristics in the given BluetoothGattService must be written.
        newValue - the value to be written.
        See Also:
        readCharacteristic(BluetoothGatt, UUID, UUID)

      • enableNotifications

        public void enableNotifications(boolean enable)
        Enables/disables notifications in all devices for the characteristics previously marked for notification.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the notifications, false to disable them.
        See Also:
        enableNotifications(BluetoothGatt, boolean), enableNotification(BluetoothGatt, UUID, UUID, boolean)

      • enableNotifications

        public void enableNotifications(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                                boolean enable)
        Enables/disables notifications in the given device for the characteristics previously marked for notification.
        Parameters:
        gatt - the GATT server in which notifications must be enabled/disabled.
        enable - true to enable the notifications, false to disable them.
        See Also:
        enableNotifications(boolean), enableNotification(BluetoothGatt, UUID, UUID, boolean)

      • enableNotification

        public void enableNotification(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt notifyGatt,
                               java.util.UUID notifyService,
                               java.util.UUID notifyCharacteristic,
                               boolean enable)
        Enables/disables notifications in the given device and service-characteristic pair.
        Parameters:
        notifyGatt - the GATT server in which notifications must be enabled/disabled or null if all connected GATT servers should be checked.
        notifyService - the BluetoothGattService in which notifications must be enabled/disabled or null if all services must be checked.
        notifyCharacteristic - the BluetoothGattCharacteristic in which notifications must be enabled/disabled or null if all BluetoothGattCharacteristics in the given BluetoothGattService must be enabled/disabled.
        enable - true to enable the notifications, false to disable them.
        See Also:
        enableNotifications(boolean), enableNotifications(BluetoothGatt, boolean)
